did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Virginia Beach (Va.) Striving For Excellence Report, 2011-2012
did.physloc: State Records Center - Archives Annex, Library of Virginia

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Beach (Va.) Striving For Excellence Report, 2011-2012. Local government records collection, Virginia Beach (City) Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in transfers of records from the city of Virginia Beach under the accession numbers 50361 and 50918.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The City of Virginia Beach was located in Princess Anne County, which is now extinct. The oceanside resort was incorporated as a town in 1906 and as a city by an act of the General Assembly in 1952. It was greatly enlarged in 1963 by consolidation with Princess Anne County, which thereby became extinct.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Virginia Beach (Va.) Striving For Excellence Report, 2011-2012, are annual reports that document the initiatives and improvements made by the city government in its delivery of services to its community. The reports include information about accreditations, awards, certifications, quality and productivity initiatives, and programs in the areas of culture and recreation, economic vitality, family and youth, education and lifelong learning, organization, physical environment, and safety.
